definition: great intelligence may appear to be stupidity (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)
a great hero may appear timid, the wise may appear stupid (idiom); the general public may not recognize great talent
pinyin: da4 yong3 ruo4 qie4 , da4 zhi4 ruo4 yu2

sentences.english: To succeed in the world we must look foolish but be wise.
sentences.chinese: 要在人世间取得成功，我们心须大智若愚。

sentences.english: Stay Hungry. Stay Foolish. And I have always wished that for myself.
sentences.chinese: 保持欲望，大智若愚，我永远以此自许。

sentences.english: Oh, no. He's quite clever. Do you know still waters run deep?
sentences.chinese: 噢，不。他相当聪明。你可知道大智若愚？

definition: the wise may appear stupid (idiom); a genius not appreciated in his own time
to act stupid/to pretend to be naive
a great hero may appear timid (idiom); the really brave person remains level-headed
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
